channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Leaders of Gateway train tunnel project sue Trump administration over withheld money
item.description: A massive tunnel project that would link New York and New Jersey could run out of money by the end of the week. Developers are suing the Trump administration in an effort go get the funding flowing.
item.content:encoded: A massive tunnel project that would link New York and New Jersey could run out of money by the end of the week. Developers are suing the Trump administration in an effort go get the funding flowing.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Nessen

item.title: The latest Epstein files are tarnishing and toppling powerful figures in the U.K.
item.description: Epstein's photos and emails have already prompted King Charles to strip his brother Andrew of his title "prince." Now, they've prompted one of Britain's top diplomats — Peter Mandelson — to step down.
item.content:encoded: Epstein's photos and emails have already prompted King Charles to strip his brother Andrew of his title "prince." Now, they've prompted one of Britain's top diplomats — Peter Mandelson — to step down.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: A thriving Muslim school in Alabama looked to expand, but was met with Islamophobia
item.description: A Muslim school near Birmingham, Ala., was thriving — winning academic awards, increasing enrollment and looking to expand. Then came the lawn signs, the first warning that trouble was on the way.
item.content:encoded: A Muslim school near Birmingham, Ala., was thriving — winning academic awards, increasing enrollment and looking to expand. Then came the lawn signs, the first warning that trouble was on the way.
item.dc:creator: Vahini Shori

item.title: A San Francisco coyote makes a great escape to Alcatraz
item.description: A coyote was spotted swimming to Alcatraz and now appears to be thriving. Ecologist Christopher Schell at the University of California Berkeley has been following this saga.
item.content:encoded: A coyote was spotted swimming to Alcatraz and now appears to be thriving. Ecologist Christopher Schell at the University of California Berkeley has been following this saga.
item.dc:creator: Gurjit Kaur

item.title: Ken Burns wants viewers to give history a second look with 'The American Revolution'
item.description: NPR's history podcast Throughline speaks with Ken Burns about his latest documentary, The American Revolution.
item.content:encoded: NPR's history podcast Throughline speaks with Ken Burns about his latest documentary, The American Revolution.

item.title: It's hard to tell, so far, what Trump has planned for the Kennedy Center
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with David Graham of The Atlantic about President Trump's vision for the Kennedy Center and the intersection of art and politics.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with David Graham of The Atlantic about President Trump's vision for the Kennedy Center and the intersection of art and politics.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Award winning poet Kimberly M. Blaeser combines science and spirituality
item.description: Kimberly Blaeser, a former poet laureate of Wisconsin, will accept a prize from the National Book Foundation next month for her collection of poems, Ancient Light.
item.content:encoded: Kimberly Blaeser, a former poet laureate of Wisconsin, will accept a prize from the National Book Foundation next month for her collection of poems, Ancient Light.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Minneapolis has daily deportation flights. One man is documenting them
item.description: A professional airplane enthusiast has been tracking the federally chartered deportation flights out of the Minneapolis airport as DHS sends detainees to other states and, eventually, other countries.
item.content:encoded: A professional airplane enthusiast has been tracking the federally chartered deportation flights out of the Minneapolis airport as DHS sends detainees to other states and, eventually, other countries.
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Trump says he wants Republicans to 'nationalize' elections
item.description: President Trump said in an interview he wants Republicans to "nationalize" elections. It's the latest instance of Trump's willingness to meddle in election administration.
item.content:encoded: President Trump said in an interview he wants Republicans to "nationalize" elections. It's the latest instance of Trump's willingness to meddle in election administration.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: VA staff feel the chill of Alex Pretti's death
item.description: Alex Pretti was an ICU nurse at the VA Hospital in Minneapolis. Some staff feel the VA Secretary hasn't done enough to honor their colleague.
item.content:encoded: Alex Pretti was an ICU nurse at the VA Hospital in Minneapolis. Some staff feel the VA Secretary hasn't done enough to honor their colleague.
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence
